decks.notes: The core idea of this deck is to gain an advantage by disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize, while also benefiting from their discards with Waste Not. It aims to control the game with removal spells like Fatal Push and Sheoldred's Edict, while utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil. Additionally, the deck has late-game threats in the form of Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kaervek, the Punisher, along with card draw and mana fixing provided by cards like Hostile Investigator and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on using low cost creatures and disruptive spells to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The deck includes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board while creatures like Dusk Legion Zealot and Vein Ripper deal damage quickly. Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord provides additional value by buffing creatures and gaining life. With a mix of aggression and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on using artifacts to create a fast and aggressive board presence, dealing damage quickly to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Voldaren Epicure, Spyglass Siren, and Smuggler's Copter to push damage through, with spells like Shrapnel Blast and Torch the Tower to finish off opponents. The deck also includes Ensoul Artifact to buff artifacts into powerful attackers. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional value and flexibility to the deck's strategy. Additionally, the deck includes some control elements like Metallic Rebuke and Spell Pierce to protect its aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing Indomitable Creativity to cheat out powerful creatures like Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord and Ob Nixilis, the Adversary. It also includes cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Vein Ripper to support the combo strategy. The deck has disruption tools like Thoughtseize and Duress to control the opponent's hand, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Sheoldred's Edict. The mana base is designed to support both black and red spells, with a mix of lands like Sulfurous Springs and Mutavault. Overall, the deck aims to be creative in its combos and interactions.

This deck revolves around quickly filling up the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix as a powerful recurring threat. Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster help fill the graveyard while providing additional value. Opt, Spell Pierce, Fiery Impulse, and Lightning Axe provide removal and card selection. Otherworldly Gaze and Treasure Cruise help maintain card advantage. The mana base is focused on ensuring consistent access to blue and red mana sources. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and leverage the graveyard as a resource for repeated threats.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on playing small, efficient creatures and empowering them with combat tricks and pump effects to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage quickly. The deck also includes cards that can protect or save key creatures from removal. With a focus on aggression and tempo, the goal is to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion further enhances the deck's efficiency and consistency.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of powerful multicolored spells and versatile mana fixing provided by the Triomes and Fabled Passage. The key strategy involves using Niv-Mizzet Reborn to draw into a wide variety of answers and threats, while utilizing cards like Vanishing Verse and Leyline Binding to deal with opposing threats. The companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, provides additional value by blinking permanents like Sylvan Caryatid and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through its diverse range of options and resources.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy while efficiently ramping up to play powerful spells using Fires of Invention. It also utilizes the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad to provide additional value and resilience. The deck includes various removal spells, card draw engines, and threats like Shark Typhoon to close out the game. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent through card advantage and efficient use of mana, ultimately winning the game through a combination of controlling the board and presenting powerful threats.
